meanings.definition: To give (money, time, knowledge, assistance, etc.) to help achieve a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: I will contribute some money to the charity event.
meanings.sent2: She always contributes her time to volunteer work.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to contribute some nuts to the picnic.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude can contribute to a brighter atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: Their teamwork will contribute to the success of the project.

meanings.definition: To play a significant part in bringing about a result.
meanings.sent1: Every team member's effort will contribute to our victory.
meanings.sent2: Her dedication will contribute to the company's growth.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics contribute to the laughter in the room.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays contribute to the warmth of the day.
meanings.sent5: His creativity will contribute greatly to the success of the play.

meanings.definition: To provide something as a part of a whole.
meanings.sent1: Each ingredient will contribute to the delicious taste of the soup.
meanings.sent2: The different colors contribute to the beauty of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle piece will contribute to completing the picture.
meanings.sent4: Every note played will contribute to the melody of the song.
meanings.sent5: Her unique perspective will contribute to the diversity of the discussion.
